document.docAuthor: Pesic, Vladimir, Saboori, Alireza, Asadi, Mahdieh & Vafaei, Reza
document.masterDocTitle: Studies on water mites of the family Hygrobatidae (Acari, Hydrachnidia) from Iran, I. The water mite genus Atractides Koch, with the description of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Studies on water mites of the family Hygrobatidae (Acari, Hydrachnidia) from Iran, I. The water mite genus Atractides Koch, with the description of five new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material
: Holotype : male, dissected and slide mounted in Hoyer's fluid; Iran : IR 53 Markazi Province, Eskan spring 30 km after Shahzand city, ca. 1780 m asl.,
21.07 . 2003
, leg. Pesic. Paratypes :
1 males
,
4 females
, same data as holotype ,
1 male
and
1 female
of these dissected and mounted on Hoyer's fluid.

Other material: IR 51 Markazi Province, Bolagh spring, 10 km after Shahzand city (in Shahzand to Pole Doab road), ca. 1780 m asl.,
21.07 . 2003
, leg. Pesic ( 2 / 3 /0); IR 54 Markazi Province, Aman Abad spring 12 km SE from Arak (in Arak to Khomein road),
22.07 . 2003
, leg. Pesic ( 2 / 3 /0); IR 28 Isfahan Province, little stream near Rahmat Abad Dam, village Domab (near Alavijeh,on road to Khansar),
31.07 . 2003
, leg. Pesic ( 1 /0/0).

Diagnosis : dorsal integument: finely striated; muscle attachments: unsclerotized. I­L­ 5 elongated, dorsal and ventral margins subparallel, S­ 1 and S­ 2 close to each other, I­L­ 6 relatively short, sausage­shaped. Genital field: Ac in an obtuse triangle, subtriangular in shape; excretory pore: smooth; Vgl­ 1 : not fused to Vgl­ 2 . Palp: strong sexual dimorphism, the sword seta is situated between the ventral hairs, the proximoventral hair of P­ 4 thicker than the distoventral hair.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–5.
Atractides markaziensis
sp. nov. , male: 1 = coxal field; 2 = genital field; 3 = I­L­5/ 6; 4–5 = palp. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Discussion : The combination of a strong sexual dimorphism in the shape of P­ 2 , unsclerotized excretory pore, unfused Vgl­ 1 / 2 , relatively short I­L­ 6 in both sexes (L I­L­ 5 / 6 > 1.6 ), setae S­ 1 / 2 rather close to each other (distance< 20 m ),
Atractides markaziensis
sp. nov. is similar to
Atractides pennatus (K.Viets, 1920 )
,
A. fonticolus (K.Viets, 1920 )
and
A. legeri (Motas, 1927 )
. From the aforementioned species,
A. markaziensis
sp. nov. , is easily distinguished in a densely striated, not lineated integument. As compared with
A. pennatus
(in parentheses data from
Gerecke, 2003
),
A. markaziensis
sp. nov. is characterized by the following characters: S­ 2 more stout, L/W< 6.5 (L/W>7.0), I­L­ 5 more stout in female, L/HB< 4.3 (L/HB> 4.3 ). The most important difference between
A. pennatus
and
A. markaziensis
sp. nov. , is found in the P­ 4 : in the male of
A. pennatus
both ventral hair insertions of P­ 4 are far proximally, while in the male of
A. markaziensis
sp. nov. the distoventral hair of P­ 4 is inserted in the distal half of the segment Moreover, the sword seta is located anteriorly from the distoventral hair in
A. pennatus
, while it is located between the ventral hairs in
A. markaziensis
sp. nov.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 6–9.
Atractides markaziensis
sp. nov. , female: 6 = coxal field; 7 = palp; 8 = genital field; 9 = I­L­5/6. Scale bar = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Atractides markaziensis
shares the presence of strongly developed sheaths at the distal margins of I­L­ 3­4 ­ 5 with
A. legeri
and
A. pennatus
. Moreover,
A. markaziensis
sp. nov. differs from
A. legeri
(in parentheses data from
Gerecke 2003
]) in the more slender and longer I­L­ 6 , L I­L­ 5 / 6 > 1.7 in both sexes (L I­L­ 5 / 6 1.75 in male, 2.4 in female), the tongue­shaped mediocaudal edge of Cx­ 1 + 2 (in both sexes mediocaudal margin Cx­ 1 + 2 indented or concave in
A. legeri
), the male genital field with convex anterior margin (anterior and posterior margins weakly indented in
A. legeri
), P­ 2 without denticulation on the ventral protrusion (P­ 2 ventrodistally with a longitudinal line separating a medial hump with three fine denticles, from a lateral, smooth elevation), the sword seta of P­ 4 curved (slender, not curved). Further differences are found in the male P­ 4 , with proximoventral hair of P­ 4 more thicker (normal in shape and slender in
A. legeri
and
A. fonticolus
) than distoventral in
A. markaziensis
sp. nov.

Atractides fonticolus
is characterized by the following features (
Gerecke 2003
): fused Vgl­ 1 / 2 in males (unfused in
A. markaziensis
sp. nov. ), in males ventrodistal projection of P­ 2 blunt and with rugose­denticulated surface (strongly protruding and smooth in
A. markaziensis
sp. nov. ), less distanced setae S­ 1­2 ,> 15 m ( 18 m in
A. markaziensis
sp. nov. ), setae S­ 1 / 2 shorter, in particular S­ 2 short and thick, L/W<5.0 (L/W>5.0 in
A. markaziensis
sp. nov. ) and the genital field with Ac more reduced in size, acetabula maximum diametar < 40 m (> 40 m in male,> 50 m in female in
A. markaziensis
).
Etymology : The species is named for its occurrence in Markazi Province.
Biology : Atractides markaziensis sp. nov. is a crenobiontic species, which inhabits springs at higher elevations.
Distribution: Iran , only known from the Markazi Province.
